title: How to promote my low content book on Amazon KDP for free - Quora

response.answer_text: One of the easiest ways I promote the books I have selling through Amazon’s KDP is to use snippets and teasers from the book, and combine them with the book link and promote them on social media. I usually make ten to twelve teaser graphics while I am waiting for my book to be edited, and have them ready to go when my books goes live on Amazon. However, the “low content” aspect of your question bothers me. I don’t even know what that means, but would add my warning to the one offered by Mary Findley below - short books won’t make you any money. They are only useful as free giveaways to help promote a longer book on the same topic or perhaps the book is a prequel to a series you have available. Short - no useful content books - get bad reviews on Amazon. Readers request a refund. If more than ten percent of your sales are given back to customers in the form of a refund, Amazon starts looking closely at your book and can withdraw it from sale if they think you are scamming their system. I would suggest writing a longer book with decent content. Thank you for the A2A.

Without knowing what in the world “low content” means, unless you are saying it’s really short, You can promote anything for free by giving it away, tweeting about it, and posting on lots of other social media, getting featured on blogs, providing press releases to online or “real” media, getting podcasters or internet show hosts to interview you — Just make sure you are not going to experience a backlash of bad reviews because reviewers don’t appreciate your “low content.” I have heard many authors say they got angry, negative reviews just because a book was short.
